snippet: The first quarter of 2016 was a fairly weak time for deal making, yet somehow the numbers came out all right.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports despite headwinds, companies globally made $682.3 billion worth of mergers and acquisitions transactions in first quarter, down from year-ago quarter but 14 percent of average first quarters over past 20 years; 8,491 deals totaled 1.6 percent less than mean.
lead_paragraph: The first quarter of 2016 was a fairly weak time for deal making, yet somehow the numbers came out all right.

headline.main: Despite Wall St. Wavering, Merger Market Is Largely Intact
headline.print_headline: Despite Wall St. Wavering and Low Oil Prices, Merger Market Holds Up
